channel.title: 718/723 Matrix : others can't connect (hamachi)
channel.description:
I'm feeling so NOOB to ask about that guys, but now I need to : I searched and tested several times and it took me a total of 6 hours. First of all, I use hamachi because I have some problems with my router settings and I cannot port forward or even access the router settings, so don't tell me to please. So I setted up my nice 718/723 matrix source (not leeched just saying, changed lots of content) and made it run, result : works perfectly. On localhost it works easily, of course, but when it comes to let my co-owner (not on the same network) enter the server, it's different. It just stays on 0%...
What I've tried :
Co-Owner's client's IP's [spoiler]127.0.0.1 (dunno why) my Hamachi ipv4 his Hamachi My network ipv4 My public IP address [/spoiler]
-Changing port -Changing (sub)revision
I'm sure that : [spoiler]Client and server are running on the same port My firewall doesn'T block the port nor is his (disabled both, tested, nothing) Client and server on 718-1 We are in direct tunnel[/spoiler]
Please help... I feel idiot about asking help for this kinda stuff, but it seems that I am too idiot to find it by myself...

item.title: 718/723 Matrix : others can't connect (hamachi)
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

[quote="-NGS-Cup, post:3, topic:545300"]Yeah I listed all the IP’s I entered in loader.java, how do I know what is the server running on, I guess It’s my IPV4 right??[/quote]I think you can check in your router

Read full topic

item.title: 718/723 Matrix : others can't connect (hamachi)
item.dc:creator: @adamgulka adamgulka
item.description:
@adamgulka wrote:

client’s ip in loader.java should be the ip of the vps, or whatever is running the server.

Read full topic

item.title: 718/723 Matrix : others can't connect (hamachi)
item.dc:creator: @NGS-Cup -NGS-Cup
item.description:
@NGS-Cup wrote:

I’m feeling so NOOB to ask about that guys, but now I need to : I searched and tested several times and it took me a total of 6 hours. First of all, I use hamachi because I have some problems with my router settings and I cannot port forward or even access the router settings, so don’t tell me to please. So I setted up my nice 718/723 matrix source (not leeched just saying, changed lots of content) and made it run, result : works perfectly. On localhost it works easily, of course, but when it comes to let my co-owner (not on the same network) enter the server, it’s different. It just stays on 0%…

What I’ve tried :

Co-Owner’s client’s IP’s
[spoiler]127.0.0.1 (dunno why)
my Hamachi ipv4
his Hamachi
My network ipv4
My public IP address
[/spoiler]

-Changing port
-Changing (sub)revision

I’m sure that :
[spoiler]Client and server are running on the same port
My firewall doesn’T block the port nor is his (disabled both, tested, nothing)
Client and server on 718-1
We are in direct tunnel[/spoiler]

Please help… I feel idiot about asking help for this kinda stuff, but it seems that I am too idiot to find it by myself…

Read full topic
